intro: Sisymbrium vernum, commonly known as field bean or yellow rocket, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant features bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, often with four petals arranged in a cross shape typical of the family. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Sisymbrium vernum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields.
